title: 105_s2107
content:
The Government Paperwork Elimination Act allows for the acquisition and use of alternative information technologies by executive agencies, including electronic submission, maintenance, and disclosure of information as a substitute for paper, as well as the use of electronic signatures. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget, in consultation with the National Telecommunications and Information Administration, must develop procedures for electronic signatures by Executive agencies within 18 months of this Act. The procedures should align with industry standards and technology, without favoring any specific industry or technology. The Director, in consultation with relevant bodies, must ensure that electronic signatures are reliable and compatible with industry standards. Procedures should not favor any specific industry or technology and should provide multiple methods of electronic signatures for forms with 50,000 or more submissions. SEC. 4. Executive agencies must implement procedures for electronic signatures and submission of information within five years of this Act. SEC. 5. Electronic storage and filing of employment forms. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must develop procedures for private employers to electronically store and file forms related to their employees within 18 months of this Act. Additionally, a study on the use of electronic signatures is required. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget, in cooperation with the National Telecommunications and Information Administration, must conduct an ongoing study on the use of electronic signatures for paperwork reduction, electronic commerce, individual privacy, and transaction security. Periodic reports on the study results must be submitted to Congress. SEC. 7. ENFORCEABILITY AND LEGAL EFFECT OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS.

Electronic records submitted in accordance with procedures developed under this Act shall not be denied legal effect, validity, or enforceability due to their electronic form.

SEC. 8. DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION.

Information collected for electronic signature services with an executive agency shall only be used with consent or for facilitating communications.

SEC. 9. APPLICATION WITH INTERNAL REVENUE LAWS. SEC. 9. APPLICATION WITH INTERNAL REVENUE LAWS.

This Act does not apply to the Department of the Treasury or the Internal Revenue Service if it involves the administration of internal revenue laws or conflicts with certain acts. SEC. 10. DEFINITIONS.

Electronic signature is a method of signing an electronic message that identifies and authenticates a person as the source and indicates their approval of the information. Executive agency is defined as per section 105 of title 5, United States Code.
